subject: chem
input_prompt:
The reaction of $\mathrm{K}_3\left[\mathrm{Fe}(\mathrm{CN})_6\right]$ with freshly prepared $\mathrm{FeSO}_4$ solution produces a dark blue precipitate called Turnbull's blue. Reaction of $\mathrm{K}_4\left[\mathrm{Fe}(\mathrm{CN})_6\right]$ with the $\mathrm{FeSO}_4$ solution in complete absence of air produces a white precipitate $\mathbf{X}$, which turns blue in air. Mixing the $\mathrm{FeSO}_4$ solution with $\mathrm{NaNO}_3$, followed by a slow addition of concentrated $\mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{SO}_4$ through the side of the test tube produces a brown ring. Among the following, the brown ring is due to the formation of

(A) $\left[\mathrm{Fe}(\mathrm{NO})_{2}\left(\mathrm{SO}_{4}\right)_{2}\right]^{2-}$

(B) $\left[\mathrm{Fe}(\mathrm{NO})_{2}\left(\mathrm{H}_{2} \mathrm{O}\right)_{4}\right]^{3+}$

(C) $\left[\mathrm{Fe}(\mathrm{NO})_{4}\left(\mathrm{SO}_{4}\right)_{2}\right]$

(D) $\left[\mathrm{Fe}(\mathrm{NO})\left(\mathrm{H}_{2} \mathrm{O}\right)_{5}\right]^{2+}$

Solve the above question. You MUST NOT ask the user for clarifications. You MUST use tools/agents to help you. Deep-research and answer the question always. Give your answer in the form FINAL ANSWER: <answer>.ONLY give the final answer letter(s) or number(s) without any additional text or explanation.
agent_final_response:
The formula for the brown ring complex is $\left[\mathrm{Fe}(\mathrm{NO})\left(\mathrm{H}_{2} \mathrm{O}\right)_{5}\right]^{2+}$.

FINAL ANSWER: (D)

full_history.content:
The reaction of $\mathrm{K}_3\left[\mathrm{Fe}(\mathrm{CN})_6\right]$ with freshly prepared $\mathrm{FeSO}_4$ solution produces a dark blue precipitate called Turnbull's blue. Reaction of $\mathrm{K}_4\left[\mathrm{Fe}(\mathrm{CN})_6\right]$ with the $\mathrm{FeSO}_4$ solution in complete absence of air produces a white precipitate $\mathbf{X}$, which turns blue in air. Mixing the $\mathrm{FeSO}_4$ solution with $\mathrm{NaNO}_3$, followed by a slow addition of concentrated $\mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{SO}_4$ through the side of the test tube produces a brown ring. Among the following, the brown ring is due to the formation of

(A) $\left[\mathrm{Fe}(\mathrm{NO})_{2}\left(\mathrm{SO}_{4}\right)_{2}\right]^{2-}$

(B) $\left[\mathrm{Fe}(\mathrm{NO})_{2}\left(\mathrm{H}_{2} \mathrm{O}\right)_{4}\right]^{3+}$

(C) $\left[\mathrm{Fe}(\mathrm{NO})_{4}\left(\mathrm{SO}_{4}\right)_{2}\right]$

(D) $\left[\mathrm{Fe}(\mathrm{NO})\left(\mathrm{H}_{2} \mathrm{O}\right)_{5}\right]^{2+}$

Brown ring testedit Nitrate Test by using Brown Ring Test A common nitrate test known as the brown ring test can be performed by adding ironII sulfate to a solution of a nitrate then slowly adding concentrated sulfuric acid such that the acid forms a layer below the aqueous solution.."
```json
}
```
